snippet: Two House members from Ohio are worried that their messages are being drowned out by thousands of attack ads.
abstract: Onslaught of negative political advertisements pummeling suburban Cleveland in battle between incumbent Reps James B Renacci, Republican, and Betty Sutton, Democrat, over Ohio's 16th Congressional District seat has both campaigns complaining of difficulty in getting their messages through to voters.
lead_paragraph: Two House members from Ohio are worried that their messages are being drowned out by thousands of attack ads.

headline.seo: Despite Thousands of Ads, Renacci and Sutton Still Feel Unheard in Ohio
headline.main: Despite Ad Barrage, Two Incumbents Vying for One Seat Still Feel Unheard
headline.print_headline: Despite Ad Barrage, Two Incumbents Vying for One Seat Still Feel Unheard
